meanings.definition: Bring to a premature end because of a problem or fault.
meanings.sent1: The storm aborted our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The pilot aborted the takeoff due to engine trouble.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was aborted when the rabbit refused to come out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a singer was abruptly aborted by stage fright.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience finally aborted when the students wouldn't stop talking.

meanings.definition: Terminate a pregnancy by removing the fetus from the womb.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to abort the pregnancy for medical reasons.
meanings.sent2: She decided to abort the pregnancy after careful consideration.
meanings.sent3: The baby shower was awkwardly aborted when the mother-to-be revealed she was planning to abort.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes for a big family were aborted after the difficult decision to terminate the pregnancy.
meanings.sent5: The emotional impact of the decision to abort can be overwhelming for some women.

meanings.sent1: The seeds aborted in the dry soil.
meanings.sent2: The project was aborted due to lack of funding.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to bake a cake was aborted when he forgot to add flour.
meanings.sent4: The plan to expand the business was aborted when the market crashed.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them slowly aborted as they drifted apart.
